title: Episode 27: Is the Internet Real?
description:
After a summer hiatus, I return to ponder the question, is the internet real? 

Thanks to my friend Andrea with the Bangs for prompting the question!

Andreas video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LTkMpQJP08U

transcript_parts.text: [Music]
welcome to another episode of the
information addicts podcast my name is
cassidy i'm an information addict and
this is my podcast where i explore
information ideas and beliefs and try to
do those things more responsibly
i am back to recording after a bit of a
summer hiatus i did some traveling
back in july and it was a lot of fun
and
definitely gave me some down time to
think a little bit about
what i've been doing and when it came to
this project gave me some time to really
think about where do i want to go with
this and so today for my first episode
back i wanted to kind of talk about some
of that and
kind of share some of the thoughts that
i've been having as i mold through some
of the things that
have been happening in the last several
months so to start i want to address a
video that my friend andrea with the
bangs made
a while back actually and it was a video
sort of asking the question and asking
for engagement on this idea of
uh is the internet real is the things
that we experience on these digital
platforms
uh
real and does it impact our lives and i
never formally responded in any way to
this video but i thought a lot about it
and and it molded my mind and it's been
on my mind especially in the last couple
months
because of
the the reality of some of these
connections relationships and
communities that i have built through
these online platforms finally getting
the chance to manifest themselves in my
real life and my
day-to-day world and
it's definitely got me sort of
thinking and pondering about the
relationship between the digital world
and the physical i think it's really
hard to argue
that
the digital world
isn't dealing with some type of reality
it's dealing with things that are real
within the world and
we're operating
in some sense with
reality
yet there is a complicated dance that
happens between these things and the way
that we're working with this
product or this um platform
that changes
us and the way that we see the world and
we interact with it i personally think
that the internet is a bit of a
double-edged sword
on one hand it gives us
the opportunity to engage with people
and things ideas that we never would
have had the chance to without
the capacities that it gives us
yet there's this other
dark side to it where there's so much
information
and so much misinformation
weaved within that world
that we couldn't
process through it all in three
lifetimes it's it's an overwhelming
burden to carry and a lot of times we
don't really know what to do with it or
how to handle it i think often
because of this we end up
in this sort of pitfall where
we begin to use the internet as a way to
curate a world that is
designed to make us feel comfortable we
start to use the internet as this way to
perfectly curate this world that
fills all of our needs all of our
desires
makes our vision of reality
line up in a way that
it can sometimes disconnect us from the
broader view of what's happening in the
world and we lose connection with
with reality when it comes to the idea
of big questions we're trying to find
answers to things that we
find important it's so easy to
construct a search that finds the
information and the answers that we want
to hear
and if we come across something that
doesn't fit our narrative we can easily
chalk it up to uh you know bad research
or some other reason why it's wrong when
it comes to social media it's easy to
block the people we don't like delete
the things we don't want to see hide
information or
types of engagement that we feel
uncomfortable with and then underneath
all of this are these algorithms that
help us in this process
learning what we like and we dislike and
finding ways to curate what we're seeing
to fit exactly
what our behavior shows that we want and
as we continue down the road it gets
narrower and narrower and we find
ourselves in these little digital
bubbles
and as we participate in this
sort of experience we we go through this
cycle of enchantment and disenchantment
of falling in love with the ideas and
the narratives we created and then
losing sight of
the humanity and those who
fit into a world that we don't really
see for ourselves and
is happening without us even fully
understanding the impact or
the the severity of the manipulation
that we are
putting on to ourselves we lose touch of
what's happening in our communities we
we lose sight of
what's going on with our neighbors and
we ultimately just start to lose a sense
of what it means
to be human and
the varied
participations within that experience
and we end up feeling
just alone i think a lot of us have
found ourselves in
a space of lost connection
with everything that's going on
in the face of coven we've all had
varying degrees of this
disconnection
to the norms of what we used to do in
real life and our physical engagement
but with the shutdowns and the new
restrictions and the limitations of of
what it is to be able to
meet in person
it's it's forced us to retreat to these
digital worlds to get a taste of this
participation in reality through this
filtered lens instead of going to
a bar to have a drink you do a zoom
conversation or send a message on
facebook instead of visiting a church
and
and
asking people what they believe we end
up
watching online sermons or or
researching comparative religion and we
lose sight of
the full scope of
what this is and participate
in this world
with almost the safety net in place i
feel like the internet has always
created the safety net there's so many
people who do things and say things that
they would never do if they
didn't find themselves with the luxury
of being behind a keyboard
and these things they're harnessed in
both
good and bad ways
but it creates this pattern where
in the good we we begin to indulge it
and we move towards it and and we
continue down the spiral of consumption
and then when it starts to become bad we
can easily turn it off when it gets to a
place where
our personal toleration for it
is uh has hit its limit and with our
participation with these worlds we don't
always see the obviously tangible
byproducts of what it is
and how it manifests in our world but
the truth is every single thing that we
do
is somehow shaping us and wiring us and
creating consequences good and bad in
our world what we consume gives us
stories about the world it gives us
preconceived notion about who people are
and
how they act and what they do and now
with kovid there's a certain level of
this participation which is a is a
safety net from the biological hazards
of of what potential consequences could
come from
um
engaging with with people these things
can persuade us from
then going into the world and
interacting and building
lives and connections in the physical
what is in many cases more risky
participation and i think for myself
the place that i've gotten to is is
really
wanting to see that cycle be broken
i i've definitely spent a lot more time
on the internet and on online
communities since covid started
that's for sure
but what i have seen in
probably the last six months to a year
is
far less information consumption in the
way that i used to do like i wasn't on
endless youtube spirals or frantically
looking at different articles trying to
get to the bottom of big questions and
find answers and
know what i could stand for confidently
i spent a lot more time
asking people questions and
understanding their stories and
um trying to see how their participation
and their experience
uh shaped them and what it said about
the bigger world around me and
i found it
so much more helpful as i learned to
participate in the world and and
navigate the uncertainty that that comes
with trying to figure out the answers to
those big questions
but i think
the thing that i've noticed in the last
month is seeing
all of these
different relationships from different
places of the internet finally manifest
themselves in my real world
and getting to participate in these same
sort of conversations or relationship
building mechanisms in person
and
just
being reminded of the limitations of
online
communication and resources
and
really longing to get back to that place
where
we
participate in our real life with the
people that we interact with day to day
in the same way that i had learned to
participate
through a computer
and it's not that i think that the
internet is an ultimate bad and that any
sort of connection to those worlds and
those spaces
should be avoided i i obviously can't
say that because through my interaction
with these things it has given me life
and it has shown me
something i could have never had if i if
i hadn't
been able to walk in that world
but it does get me to
poke more at the question of
how do we be more intentional with our
participation in these fields
what am i consuming and why and how is
it shaping my narrative
when am i consuming too much or when am
i
trying to avoid something and how do i
acknowledge that and
change trajectories when i'm going down
this path
but i think for me
the thing that
resonates most and that is most pressing
to sort of
participate in and
and try to answer the question is how do
we
participate in all of those things with
others
and how do we take that
and and manifest it into
the physical relationships and the
physical communities that we have
instead of just letting it live
in a digital space
i think far more often people are having
important conversations in digital
landscapes but it never
leaves there and
it's not sufficient like i think there
is something in us that needs that in
our real world and that engagement and
connection
um and and
the good and the bad and everything that
it has and learning how to dance within
the chaos to try to come to
a better a better
life
and something that produces more life
instead of death and so
with all that it kind of leads me to the
question
how do i do that with this channel
and
as far as the format goes there's
there's not going to be a lot that's
changing i'm still going to do
the monologues i'm still going to do in
conversations but i really want to try
and
focus what i do more on those questions
and learning how to do that and keep
keep the focus on learning how to
interact with others as
we navigate these big questions and and
find a way to bring that
need for us
to explore these things in different
ways and learn from others
into
the real world i just i really want to
avoid this enslavement and consumption
of
ourselves to the digital world and let
that
participation
cultivate in something beautiful
in
our everyday lives and help us commune
with others around us in a more tangible
way
and i i think i also want to keep
challenging myself and
unpacking the ideas and the new things
that i
have
been working on and trying to form and
experience
there's been a lot that's changed in the
last couple years for myself
and
there's a lot that is still changing and
i'm
i'm want to
keep learning how to challenge myself
and and
walk confidently in my participation of
those things
at the aim of
living a better life and living a truer
life
and through this project i've been able
to interact and connect with people i
never would have if i hadn't done it and
i'm so grateful for all the help that
everyone has given me and the
ideas that i have
been able to engage with that that
reshape my view of the world
and so i would hate to lose sight of
that and allow this place to be a
vehicle to
learn what it means to not placate what
i believe in my ideas
but still be open to new information and
be willing to be proven wrong and
learning to
be more concerned about having my mind
change than others and i hope that
through all of this i can continue
to operate in that spirit
so with that i i don't have
much left but i i hope that
um you enjoyed
this and and where i want to take this
if you
have any questions or suggestions please
leave comments i do like in engaging
with you and reading those comments i'm
not always the best at
uh responding back um or
being as engaged on online
communities through text it's not my
strong suit but
i definitely appreciate the feedback and
and i learn a lot and
uh
think a lot about the things that you
guys have to share so thank you for that
as well
i guess with that i will close with the
serenity prayer
god grant me this remedy to accept the
things i cannot change the courage to
change the things i can and the wisdom
[Music]
bye
